text: What they called betrayal, I call clarity.
He leaves a red trail behind, not from his wounds, but others’.
Each kill drives the next, like a drumbeat in a storm.
He remembers the beast he tried to kill—and dreams of finishing the deed.
When they think they’ve broken him, he reveals his final edge.
Somewhere between carnage and treachery, Berus always smiles.
Twin crescents of death, wielded like extensions of his rage.
Walls of spears mean nothing when the brute is faster than the charge.
Exiled by monsters, reborn as one – Berus is vengeance without chains.
A brute of speed and malice, Berus slaughters with deliberate treachery.

Berus was once of the Dolgan, a northern tribe hardened by snow and war. He served Sayl the Faithless, enduring horrors in return for power, until the day he turned on Sayl's pet Chaos Spawn, Nightmaw. Exiled for his defiance, Berus fled with nothing but his fury. Time in the Wastes honed his brutality – he became fast, brutal, cunning. When Einarr Sigdansson marched on the north, it was Berus who offered paths through cursed lands only he had survived. But even now, treachery stirs beneath his loyalty.
He leaves a red trail behind, not from his wounds, but others’.
Rusted, jagged, and enchanted by accident, this axe drinks spite from its wielder’s veins.
